problem.prob_desc: 30. 실수 전체의 집합에서 미분가능한 함수 $f(x)$의 도함수 $f'(x)$가 $$f'(x) = |\sin x|\cos x$$이다. 양수 $a$에 대하여 곡선 $y=f(x)$ 위의 점 $(a, f(a))$에서의 접선의 방정식을 $y=g(x)$라 하자. 함수 $$h(x) = \int_{0}^{x} \{ f(t) - g(t) \}\, dt$$가 $x=a$에서 극대 또는 극소가 되도록 하는 모든 양수 $a$를 작은 수부터 크기 순으로 나열할 때, $n$번째 수를 $a_n$이라 하자. $\dfrac{100}{\pi} \times (a_6 - a_2)$의 값을 구하시오. [4점]

gpt-5-codex.title: Extremum condition for h
gpt-5-codex.body: With g(x) = f(a) + f'(a)(x-a), we have h(x) = ∫₀ˣ [f(t) - g(t)] dt. Differentiating gives h'(x) = f(x) - g(x) and h''(x) = f'(x) - f'(a). Since h'(a) = 0 automatically, x = a is an extremum of h only if h'(x) changes sign around a, i.e., f(x) - g(x) changes sign around x = a.

gpt-5-codex.title: Consequence for f''(a)
gpt-5-codex.body: Near x = a, let F(x) = f(x) - g(x). If f is twice differentiable at a with f''(a) ≠ 0, then F(x) ≈ ½f''(a)(x-a)², which keeps the same sign on both sides of a, so h has no extremum. Therefore, an extremum can occur only when f''(a) = 0 or f'' is undefined at a.

gpt-5-codex.title: Find candidate points
gpt-5-codex.body:
Since f'(x) = |sin x| cos x, we have:
• For sin x > 0 (x ∈ (2kπ, (2k+1)π)), f'(x) = sin x cos x and f''(x) = cos 2x.
• For sin x < 0 (x ∈ ((2k-1)π, 2kπ)), f'(x) = -sin x cos x and f''(x) = -cos 2x.
Thus f'' is zero precisely when cos 2a = 0, i.e., a = π/4 + k·(π/2). At sin a = 0 (a = kπ), f'' is not defined because |sin x| has a kink; these points must also be checked.

gpt-5-codex.title: Verify sign change at candidates
gpt-5-codex.body: For a = π/4 + k·(π/2), f''(a) = 0 and the one-sided third derivative is f'''(a) = ±2 sin 2a ≠ 0, hence F(x) ≈ (f'''(a)/6)(x-a)³, which changes sign across a; h has a local extremum there. For a = kπ, f'(a) = 0 and near a the function f'(x) keeps a definite sign (both sides positive when k is even, both negative when k is odd), so F(x) = ∫ₐˣ f'(u) du changes sign across a; h again has a local extremum. No other points satisfy the requirement.

gpt-5-codex.title: Sort positive solutions
gpt-5-codex.body: Arrange the positive a: π/4, 3π/4, π, 5π/4, 7π/4, 2π, 9π/4, … Therefore, a₂ = 3π/4 and a₆ = 2π.

gpt-5.title: Reduce to sign change of h′
gpt-5.body: Given g(x) is the tangent to y=f(x) at x=a, g(x)=f(a)+f′(a)(x−a). Define h(x)=∫₀ˣ (f(t)−g(t)) dt. Then h′(x)=f(x)−g(x). Always h′(a)=f(a)−g(a)=0. For a to be a local max/min of h, h′ must change sign at x=a. Since h′(x)=f(x)−g(x), this occurs exactly when the tangent at a crosses the graph of f (i.e., f−g changes sign across a).

gpt-5.title: Crossing ⇔ inflection of f
gpt-5.body: If f is strictly convex or strictly concave near a, its graph lies entirely above or below its tangent, so f−g keeps one sign and h has no extremum at a. Thus h has a local extremum at a iff a is an inflection point of f (the curvature changes sign across a). This can occur where f″(a)=0 with sign change, or where f″ is undefined but one-sided signs are opposite.

gpt-5.title: Find all inflection points of f
gpt-5.body: We have f′(x)=|sin x| cos x. On intervals where sin x>0 (x∈(2mπ,(2m+1)π)), f′(x)=½ sin 2x, so f″(x)=cos 2x. Where sin x<0 (x∈((2m−1)π,2mπ)), f′(x)=−½ sin 2x, so f″(x)=−cos 2x. Hence: (i) Interior zeros of f″ occur at cos 2x=0 ⇒ x=π/4+k(π/2), at which cos 2x changes sign; sgn(sin x) is constant on each side, so f″ changes sign ⇒ inflection. (ii) At x=nπ, sin x changes sign; near these points cos 2x≈1, so f″ jumps from ±1 to ∓1 across x=nπ, again a sign change ⇒ inflection. Therefore, all positive a with extremum are a∈{π/4+k(π/2) : k∈ℤ, a>0} ∪ {nπ : n∈ℕ}. In ascending order this is precisely the multiples of π/4 excluding those ≡2 (mod 4): a_n=(π/4)·b_n where b_n runs over 1,3,4,5,7,8,9,11,12,13,...

claude-opus-4.5.title: Analyze the derivative f'(x)
claude-opus-4.5.body:
Given f'(x) = |sin x| cos x

For x ∈ [0, π]: |sin x| = sin x, so f'(x) = sin x cos x = (1/2)sin 2x
For x ∈ [π, 2π]: |sin x| = -sin x, so f'(x) = -sin x cos x = -(1/2)sin 2x

The pattern repeats with period 2π.

claude-opus-4.5.title: Set up h(x) and find h'(x)
claude-opus-4.5.body:
The tangent line at (a, f(a)) is: y = g(x) = f(a) + f'(a)(x - a)

So f(x) - g(x) = f(x) - f(a) - f'(a)(x - a)

h(x) = ∫₀ˣ {f(t) - g(t)} dt

By the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus:
h'(x) = f(x) - g(x) = f(x) - f(a) - f'(a)(x - a)

claude-opus-4.5.title: Conditions for extremum at x = a
claude-opus-4.5.body:
For h(x) to have an extremum at x = a:
1. h'(a) = 0: f(a) - f(a) - f'(a)(a - a) = 0 ✓ (always satisfied)
2. h'(x) must change sign at x = a

Since h'(a) = 0 always, we need h''(a) = 0 and examine higher derivatives, OR h'(x) must change sign.

h''(x) = f'(x) - f'(a)
h''(a) = f'(a) - f'(a) = 0 (always)

h'''(x) = f''(x)
h'''(a) = f''(a)

For a local extremum: we need h'(x) to change sign at x = a.
Since h'(a) = 0 and h''(a) = 0, we examine when f'(x) - f'(a) changes sign at x = a.

claude-opus-4.5.title: Determine when f'(x) has local extremum
claude-opus-4.5.body:
For h'(x) = f(x) - f(a) - f'(a)(x-a) to change sign at x = a:
The tangent line to f at x = a must cross the curve (not just touch it).

This happens when f''(a) = 0 AND f'''(a) ≠ 0 (inflection point of f), OR when f'(x) has a local extremum at x = a.

f''(x) = d/dx[|sin x| cos x]

For x ∈ (0, π): f''(x) = cos 2x · 2 = 2cos 2x = 0 when x = π/4, 3π/4
For x ∈ (π, 2π): f''(x) = -2cos 2x = 0 when x = 5π/4, 7π/4

Also at x = π, 2π, ... where |sin x| has corners.

claude-opus-4.5.title: Find where f'(x) has local extrema
claude-opus-4.5.body:
f'(x) = |sin x| cos x

Local extrema of f'(x) occur where f''(x) = 0 or f''(x) doesn't exist.

In (0, π): f''(x) = 2cos 2x = 0 at x = π/4, 3π/4
In (π, 2π): f''(x) = -2cos 2x = 0 at x = 5π/4, 7π/4
At x = π, 2π, 3π,...: f''(x) doesn't exist (corner points of |sin x|)

Check sign changes of f''(x):
- At x = π/4: f'' changes + to - (local max of f')
- At x = 3π/4: f'' changes - to + (local min of f')
- At x = π: corner point - need to check
- At x = 5π/4: f'' changes + to - (local max of f')
- At x = 7π/4: f'' changes - to + (local min of f')

At these points, f'(x) has local extrema, so tangent crosses curve.

claude-opus-4.5.title: List all positive values of a
claude-opus-4.5.body:
The positive values where h(x) has extremum at x = a are where f'(x) has local extrema:

a₁ = π/4
a₂ = 3π/4
a₃ = π (corner)
a₄ = 5π/4
a₅ = 7π/4
a₆ = 2π (corner)

Continuing: 9π/4, 11π/4, 3π, ...

gemini-3-pro.title: Analyze the derivative f'(x)
gemini-3-pro.body:
Given $f'(x) = |\sin x|\cos x$, we determine its explicit form in intervals of length $\pi$. Since $\sin x \ge 0$ for $x \in [2k\pi, (2k+1)\pi]$ and $\sin x < 0$ for $x \in [(2k+1)\pi, (2k+2)\pi]$, we have:
- For $2k\pi \le x \le (2k+1)\pi$: $f'(x) = \sin x \cos x = \frac{1}{2}\sin 2x$.
- For $(2k+1)\pi \le x \le (2k+2)\pi$: $f'(x) = -\sin x \cos x = -\frac{1}{2}\sin 2x$.

gemini-3-pro.title: Analyze the condition for extrema of h(x)
gemini-3-pro.body: We need $h(x) = \int_0^x \{ f(t) - g(t) \} dt$ to have a local extremum at $x=a$. This requires $h'(x) = f(x) - g(x)$ to change sign at $x=a$. Since $g(x)$ is the tangent to $f(x)$ at $x=a$, $f(x)$ touches $g(x)$ at $a$. For $f(x)-g(x)$ to change sign (cross the tangent), $x=a$ must be an inflection point of $f(x)$ where the concavity changes (e.g., from convex to concave or vice versa).

gemini-3-pro.title: Find inflection points inside the intervals
gemini-3-pro.body:
We find where $f''(x)$ changes sign.
- In $(0, \pi)$, $f''(x) = (\frac{1}{2}\sin 2x)' = \cos 2x$. Roots are $2x = \frac{\pi}{2}, \frac{3\pi}{2} \Rightarrow x = \frac{\pi}{4}, \frac{3\pi}{4}$. Concavity changes at these points.
- In $(\pi, 2\pi)$, $f''(x) = (-\frac{1}{2}\sin 2x)' = -\cos 2x$. Roots are $2x = \frac{5\pi}{2}, \frac{7\pi}{2} \Rightarrow x = \frac{5\pi}{4}, \frac{7\pi}{4}$. Concavity changes here as well.

gemini-3-pro.title: Check inflection points at boundaries
gemini-3-pro.body:
We examine $x = \pi$ (and generally $n\pi$).
- As $x \to \pi^-$, $f''(x) = \cos 2x \to 1 > 0$ (Convex).
- As $x \to \pi^+$, $f''(x) = -\cos 2x \to -1 < 0$ (Concave).
The concavity changes from convex to concave at $x=\pi$, so the tangent crosses the curve. $f(x)-g(x)$ changes sign. Thus, $x=\pi$ is a valid point.
Similarly, at $x=2\pi$, concavity changes from concave ($f'' \to -1$) to convex ($f'' \to 1$), so $x=2\pi$ is valid.

gemini-3-pro.title: List and sort the values of a
gemini-3-pro.body:
Collecting the positive points $a$ in increasing order:
1. $a_1 = \frac{\pi}{4}$ 
2. $a_2 = \frac{3\pi}{4}$ 
3. $a_3 = \pi$ 
4. $a_4 = \frac{5\pi}{4}$ 
5. $a_5 = \frac{7\pi}{4}$ 
6. $a_6 = 2\pi$ 
We need $a_2$ and $a_6$.

gemini-3-pro.title: Calculate the final value
gemini-3-pro.body:
We substitute $a_6 = 2\pi$ and $a_2 = \frac{3\pi}{4}$ into the expression:
$a_6 - a_2 = 2\pi - \frac{3\pi}{4} = \frac{5\pi}{4}$.
The required value is $\frac{100}{\pi} \times (a_6 - a_2) = \frac{100}{\pi} \times \frac{5\pi}{4} = 100 \times \frac{5}{4} = 125$.

grok-4-fast.title: Find f(x) by integrating f'(x)
grok-4-fast.body: Given f'(x) = |sin x| cos x, substitute u = sin x, du = cos x dx, so ∫ |u| du = (1/2) u |u| + C = (1/2) sin x |sin x| + C. Thus, f(x) = (1/2) sin x |sin x| + C. For simplicity, set C = 0 as constants cancel in differences.

grok-4-fast.title: Define g(x) and h(x)
grok-4-fast.body: The tangent at x = a is g(x) = f(a) + f'(a)(x - a). Then h(x) = ∫_0^x [f(t) - g(t)] dt, so h'(x) = f(x) - g(x).

grok-4-fast.title: Determine condition for extremum
grok-4-fast.body: h'(a) = 0 always (tangency). For local max/min, h'(x) must change sign at x = a, i.e., the zero of h'(x) at a has odd multiplicity m ≥ 3. Since m ≥ 2 always, compute derivatives: h'(x) = (1/2) f''(a)(x-a)^2 + (1/6) f'''(a)(x-a)^3 + ⋯. If f''(a) ≠ 0, m=2 even, no extremum. If f''(a)=0 and f'''(a) ≠ 0, m=3 odd, extremum.

grok-4-fast.title: Compute f''(x) and solve f''(a)=0
grok-4-fast.body: In (2kπ, (2k+1)π), f''(x) = cos 2x. In ((2k+1)π, (2k+2)π), f''(x) = -cos 2x. Set ± cos 2a = 0 ⇒ cos 2a = 0 ⇒ 2a = π/2 + kπ ⇒ a = (2n-1)π/4 for integer n ≥ 1 (positive a).

grok-4-fast.title: Verify f'''(a) ≠ 0
grok-4-fast.body: In respective intervals, f'''(x) = -2 sin 2x or +2 sin 2x. At a = (2n-1)π/4, 2a = (2n-1)π/2, sin 2a = (-1)^{n-1}, so |sin 2a| = 1 ≠ 0, hence |f'''(a)| = 2 ≠ 0. Thus, m=3 for all such a.

grok-4-fast.title: List a_n and compute required value
